title: fair or not ?

embed.description: Create & discover new Champion builds/strategies, check your Summoner statistics and try our powerful LoL charts.

body: okay i just want to start off by saying i don't really mind that much because it was just a chat restriction.  but i feel like this is very unfair and riot needs to look into shit before they ban people.  tell me if i am in the wrong okay please guys. so here is what happend i get in to a ranked game. just in the champion select.  and my team mate get's support so he starts begging me for my lane i am jg.  by begging i mean please bro please can i have your lane i am a shit support. he begs some more saying give lane bruh. about nine times. i reply with if you are bad at support why did you look for it?. he replys with short q bro. i then reply with you get the lane you get it's your fault. i thne tell him to stop begging and being a %%%got. he then bans my champion i wanted to play and calls me a %%%got.  he then says he's going to feed and i am like well if i dodge i lose the same amount of lp. which sucks :P . and so the game goes on and he feeds and throws . his name is best smurf oce. and he played teemo he went 0/31/0 and bitched the whole game about respect  and shit. and at the end of the game i get a char restriction for calling a 0/31/0 teemo. a %%%got. is this fair or not?

replies.body:
You still called him names when it wasn't necessary. 
You could have just said "No sorry dude."
Even if you had said that to me I would have been like "Ok, what evs."
Even tho I main support.

But instead you called him names first, you were the first one to act.
I would have been extremely pissed too, to a point you abused him.
Yes you deserve that chat restriction.

Because of you even slightly name calling someone, you got 3 other summoners to lose there game.

Also name and shaming is not ok, it sucks but there is a reason for it. Remove the name and link please.
i'd rather dodge than getting at least 20 minutes of drama

Based on the information you've provided, both of you were in the wrong.

It's true enough that if they didn't want to play support they shouldn't have queued for it *however* that's no reason to name call, and, let's face it, that seems to be where the issues actually started.

They were in the wrong for offensive language/harassment and feeding, *however* you were also in the wrong for offensive language/harassment.

It's entirely possible that the situation never would have escalated if you had decided *not* to offend them.
